LiquidPiston, Inc. is seeking a Director of Machine Learning to build out data and machine learning solutions to accelerate the development of our rotary internal combustion engines. This job may be done remotely, or located in our Bloomfield, CT office.In this position you will:Develop a roadmap for applications of machine learning to engine design including architecting a high performance computing environment, developing data capture protocols, identifying and prioritizing ML use cases, etc.Create and modify machine learning models related to engines, generators, hybrid power systems, UAV’s, etc.Analyze and validate modeling results with experimental dataRecommend changes to optimize system performanceDocument results verbally and through formal/informal written reportsCollaborate and respond to requests from the Engineering team, including commonly from the CEO and CTOManage time and resources between multiple projectsParticipate in weekly technical meetings, summarizing key accomplishments and plansUse Python, R and / or Matlab as primary modeling toolsSelect and act as a primary technical contact for any outsourced modeling workMaintain a spirited, open-minded personality and “can-do” attitude during the course of often challenging R&D projectsRequirements:Ph.D in Computer Science with BS/Masters in Data Science & Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, etc.Experience using advanced analytics tools to combine large datasets and analyze them in big data environments, such as ADL, AWS, Snowflake, etc.3+ years of professional experience in scientific computing/data science using numerical methods, statistical analysis and optimization techniquesCoding experience is a mustFundamental understanding of Physics and ThermodynamicsDemonstrated ability to understand, model, and optimize physical systemsAbility to self-direct and independently solve problems, including “thinking outside the box”Ability to learn find and learn from technical papers/journalsHelpful Skills:Experience or interest in rotary, piston, turbine enginesExperience with setting up and maintaining your own IT and data systems, including kubernetes, ZFS, Docker, engineering software license management, etc.Experience developing GUI’sExperience working back and forth between simulation and real-world testingProposal writing skillsExperience working around a machine shop/prototype manufacturing/ R&D environmentExperience supporting novel product developmentExperience with 3D modeling (Solidworks) and other common mechanical engineering simulation tools (ANSYS, GT Suite) Benefits: Take time. One of the things we value about our work culture is our people. We work hard, but also have a flexible paid time off policy, encouraging employees to unplug and refuel! Daily work hours can flex around what works best for your work-life balance.Health And Wellness Help Us Show Up.We provide a total rewards package including medical, dental, and vision coverage. You choose what works for you!Ownership.Our permanent employees are invested in what we do through the offering of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).Don’t leave money on the table. We offer a 401k w/100% matching up to 3% of your salary and then 50% of contributions between 3-5%.Never stop learning. We have training programs to LAUNCH your career through specialization courses, seminars, and other lifelong learning and development resources.LiquidPiston, Inc. will ensure that all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.Powered by JazzHR7uKNjEp98W
